content: yarn and work in white and black stripes k2tog black k6 grey ssk grey k1 grey 31 sts carrying the unused colour up the side of the work row 17 p8 grey p6 black p3 grey p6 black as you use the other colour p8 grey row 5 to 6 in black starting on a ws purl row row 18 k1 grey k2tog grey k5 grey ssk black work 2 row in st st k2 black ssk black k3 grey k2tog black k2 black row 7 to 8 in white starting on a ws purl row k2tog black k5 grey ssk grey k1 grey 25 sts work 2 row in st st break the bobbins of grey and black yarns and join row 9 in black purl the ball of white yarn for the muzzle row 10 in black k1 k2tog k5 3 times 19 sts row 19 purl row 11 in white purl row 20 k1 k2tog k6 ssk k3 k2tog k6 ssk k1 21 sts row 12 in white k1 k2tog k4 3 times 16 sts row 21 purl row 13 in black purl woodland tales mobile copyright © 2018 amanda berry page 5 of 10 row 14 in black k1 k2tog k3 3 times 13 sts squirrel head make 1 follow the raccoon head patt pages 4 break the black yarn and work the last 4 row in to 5 working all row in grey yarn only white row 15 purl row 16 k1 k2tog k2 3 times 10 sts knitting loops row 17 purl the squirrel tail is made by knitting loops to knit a single loop row 18 k1 k2tog k1 3 times 7 sts - knit into the stitch but do not allow the original pull through to cast off stitch to fall off the lh needle bring the yarn forward between the tips of the needles to the raccoon ears front make 2 cast on 12 sts in grey on 3 25mm needles - stretch out your left thumb so that it is in front of the knitting and wrap the yarn around and under row 1 knit it row 2 k2tog 6 times 6 sts - take the yarn back between the tips of the row 3 knit needles to the back keeping it wrapped around row 4 k2tog 3 times 3 sts your thumb to make a loop pull through to cast off - knit into the same stitch again on the lh needle and drop the original stitch off the lh needle take your thumb out of the loop - put the tip of the lh needle through the front of the two stitches just made on the rh needle and knit together a tutorial on how to knit loops is available from http //fluffandfuzz weebly com/knitting-tutorials/ how-to-knit-loops squirrel tail make 1 start at the tip of the tail cast on 16 sts in squirrel body grey on 3 25mm needles make 1 follow the fox body patt page 3
